entry.title: Combined summary - [PATCH] Boost filesystem v3 support
entry.summary: A patch has been created to adapt a single line of code to support Boost filesystem version 3, which is the default in Boost 1.46 and required for 1.48+. The author of the patch tested it with Boost 1.41.0 to confirm that it still works on older versions. The patch file is attached to the message, along with details about its type, size, and format. Luke-Jr proposed the patch on August 19, 2011. Jeff Garzik responded on August 24, 2011, stating that although the change appeared to be technically correct, he was disappointed that #ifdefs were present in the code. Jeff suggested that most projects work to hide such details in headers to keep the code cleaner. However, Jeff acknowledged that this guideline was not a hard rule, as there are already plenty of #ifdef windows code.Despite Jeff's concerns about the #ifdefs, Luke-Jr sent the patch to adapt the one line needed to support Boost filesystem version 3. He confirmed that he had tested it with Boost 1.41.0 to ensure it would still work on older versions.
